186002387.review:
The story is faithful to the classic Wolfenstein games and the gameplay takes all the good mechanics from New Order. This entire expansion is basically one big reference to Return to Castle Wolfenstein while serving as a prequel to New Order itself.

Is it perfect? No.

The intro, a Sly Cooper-esque forced stealth segment that is completely devoid of fun, takes an hour to get through which is a significant portion of the actual runtime considering the whole campaign is about 10 hrs. 
Really the only sequence where all the fun mechanics are fully on display is one single room, or i guess technically two rooms if you count the fact the game lets you choose between two rooms where this sequence takes place. 

This is the only Machine Games Wolfenstein product that truly seems to understand what is fun about the ridiculous nature of the fictional world where Wolfenstein takes place, and the contrast is never more illustrated than at the end of the game: 
You just finished fighting off flaming Nazi zombie soldiers literally falling from the sky and a giant mummy boss that was revived from ancient ruins by reciting a curse when the game pulls a 180 as it merges into referencing the beginning of New Order, prompting BJ to go on a whining depressing monologue about how the world is terrible and evil can never be defeated. 

Its almost as if they are trying to say to the customer "alright you had your fun with Old Blood now its time to sit down and get serious as you listen to our legitimate ideology about the world/political opinion for the next 3 full length games".
Its sad to see one of my favorite game series of all time shift into thinking what the fans want is gameplay to take a backseat to their terrible storywriting, annoying cutscenes, and political opinion showcase.

But to avoid my review ending on a depressing note like this game itself....MEIN LEBEN!!!!!

185948920.review: Optimización nivel dios... PC tope de gama ryzen 7 7800x3d y rx7800xt de 16gb y aun así se crashea dando igual lo jueges a baja, ultra o klk...

185921035.review:
Beat this game and I'd suggest anyone that wants to play thru the series just skip this one tbh. At first you're excited cause of the location and where you're going. You're excited for the story that led to the first game. But the game goes off the rails with zombies at one point. The "stealth" hardly exists where as it's something you can actually do in the first game. This game you CAN stealth certain sections it's not anything close to the first game. The climbing mechanic is lame, I don't like having to left click hold, right click hold, let go of left click, left click hold, etc. etc. Breaking the walls mechanic is half assed, you end up throwing your knives at the walls half the time. Speaking of walls and climbing segments you'll end up in a room/dead end trying to figure out where you're supposed to go. Guess what? It's some climbable wall that just blends into the environment, looks like it's just an asset. Same with the breakable walls. Some points in the combat like when escaping Wolfenstien is ridiculous. The tram part is just dumb with out accurate and how many grenades the enemies throw. On top of that, majority of the enemies in this game are armored. Which goes back to the stealth bit, you can't stealth your way past armored people cause headshots do nothing and shooting them multiple times they will yell. They really shoe horned a bunch of crap into this game for what reasons? I'm not sure. I just really hope that the next game doesn't have everything this game does. I really hope it goes back to the way the first game was.

I wanted to play a game where the Nazis were messing with the occult stuff and making grotesque machines with human body parts and stuff, not a Nazi zombies game. The ONLY way this game "makes sense" is if it's canon to Doom. That being said, not ONCE in the first game, which takes place AFTER this game, did BJ ever mention anything about zombies or people coming back from the dead. Which would have been something that would of 100% been brought up if this game came out BEFORE the first game. Just ridiculous.

185889636.review:
Das Spiel hat mir insgesamt sehr gut gefallen und ich kann es wärmstens weiterempfehlen. Besonders für Trophäenjäger ist es eine echte Empfehlung, da es nur etwa 10 Stunden dauert, um die Platin-Trophäe zu erreichen. Die Herausforderungen sind dabei nicht übermäßig schwer, sodass auch Gelegenheitsspieler eine Chance haben, die 100 % zu erreichen.

Was mir besonders gefallen hat, war die gelungene Kombination aus Gameplay, Story und Atmosphäre. Das Spiel schafft es, von Anfang bis Ende zu fesseln, ohne sich dabei unnötig in die Länge zu ziehen. Für alle, die nach einem spaßigen Spiel suchen, das zugleich lohnend für Trophäen-Grinder ist, ist dieses hier genau das Richtige!

185776104.review:
The New Order - 3/5
The New Colossus: 3.5/5, best story
The Old Blood - 3.5/5, best gameplay
Play order recommendation: TNO -> TNC -> TOB

TOB is a refinement of TNO in every aspect except for story. Gunplay is more varied, enemies require more strategies to dispatch, and combat arenas are tightly designed to encourage movement and weapon-switching. The story isn't great, but it doesn't really matter, both for the game itself and the larger story of the new saga. The final boss sucks ass (somehow worse than the bosses in TNO), but this is still the only new Wolfenstein game I'd want to come back to and play again.

185756063.review:
Probably my favorite out of the new Wolfenstein games simply because it doesn't overstay its welcome. Originally planned to be a 2-part DLC for New Order, its very easy to tell that this game doesn't have time to linger on mechanics or settings - its constantly moving without feeling rushed because its building off previously established ideas. Great art direction and level design as well.
I also really like the super natural vibe of this one. This is a pretty good Indiana Jones game, which is ironic to say in 2025 after Machine Games delivered on the official IP too

185599556.review:
Much shorter than The New Order. Stealth doesn't exist. Enemies will hear or see you whatever the approach you take, so the best solution for every stage is just to run for a kill of chief commanders to stop them from calling support, then clear the stage from the rest of enemies and explore every corner in peace.

I really liked the setup, monumental buiildings, the castle, Paderborn, Wulfburg, nazi Germany in late 40's, very climatic, but that was always the strongest aspect of Wolfenstain games.

Didn't like the zombies, sci-fun/fantasy late game stages, final boss pretty annoying as well. They figured it's too easy on it's own so they decided to throw regular enemies at you during the fight. Such moves are always bs.
Gun feeling is not as good, story is weaker than in TNO, but the environment and the world around really keeps you interesed enough to keep going with hunger for more.

Overall - mediocre. Get it only on a discount.

185467992.review:
The Steam Clown Award is an absolutely stupid concept. It serves no real purpose other than to belittle and shame people, offering no constructive value whatsoever. Instead of encouraging positive feedback or meaningful critique, it just reinforces a culture of mockery and pointless trolling. The whole idea is absurd—it’s not even a genuine award, just a ridiculous label meant to humiliate. The fact that it’s even taken seriously by some people is baffling, as it contributes nothing but negativity. In a space where feedback and improvement should be prioritized, the Steam Clown Award is just a senseless, juvenile distraction that serves no beneficial function.

Anyways... great game, liked this one more compared to their other ones. Wolfenstein games are one of a kind, so glad i stumbled upon them randomly years ago.

185402734.review:
One of the best prequels EVER! I love "Wolfenstein : The Old Blood" for countless reasons, it's a wonderful prequel that sets the stage for "The New Order" so well. This game is also so gorgeous to look at, running on the same engine as the "The New Order" this game features beautiful set pieces. Taking you from a bright and sunny drive up towards Castle Wolfenstein, to it's deep and darkest dungeons and then back to surface for a nice cable car ride down the steep mountain and more!  The ending of this game leaves you with a burning desire to kill Nazi's in the future. However, "The Old Blood" takes you back in time and undercover to the infamous CASTLE WOLFENSTEIN!!! 

The game is divided into 2 parts with the 2nd part taking a drastic turn (for the best). The 1st half feels like a normal shooter but then the 2nd half really kicks in the "Wolfenstein" element, with the diabolical scheme that the Nazi's were undergoing deep in the catacombs of the church. The characters that were introduced were all great additions to the lore, sadly they were all expendable and we will see none of them again. The game also gives you a "choice" option although it really does not matter who you pick to save (sadly). 

Shooting is just what you would expect from a "Wolfenstein" game, pulse pounding shootouts, gory executions and phenomenal gun-play. Game-play is solid overall, loved the retro weapons that were utilized in this prequel as well, a nice homage to the previous "Wolfenstein" titles and the WW2 German weapons. Still sadly not one MP-40 in sight. No idea what Machine Games has against the MP-40. 

All in all, this game is a wonderful addition to the "Wolfenstein" IP. A little too short IMO but that's only because I was having so much fun with this title. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves first person shooters with a sweat dripping combat loop, great exploration and awesome story.

185156630.review:
Yah! Ein Hot Dog!

Always knew Greta Thunberg has a dog’s name! I love Rudi Jager and his dog Greta. Great bosses and humor. Scenery, graphics and controls are smooth and no glitch problems occurred. The game takes you on a journey of the archaeological findings of the SS paranormal division. Very Indiana Jones like. Wolfenstein Old Blood is almost like a remastered Wolfenstein Return to the Castle. Some things the same while some things different. Some things better and some things worse. The soundtracks by Mick Gordon are fitting. I wish the letters that are picked up to be German translated side by side to English like the New Order game did it and to have radio songs like the New Order. The game has these challenge modes, but I think they could have used that time developing much more levels. That is a very big castle. The game could have been better by having more variety of weapons/vehicles, soldiers and more bosses. I wish we could flown the Horten Ho 229. The ending is a great crossover to the New Order. This game overall is a well-done prequel to the Wolfenstein New Order.

184854900.review:
[h1] Um enredo mediano que não agrega em quase nada na história desse reboot. [h1] 

[h2] SPOILER!!! 

 A história é bem simples, Blazkowicz e mais um agente entram no Castelo Wolfenstein para conseguir informações de Helga Von Shabbs (a vilã do jogo) que mostram a localização do general Wilhelm Strasse (vilão principal do The New Order) porém obviamente as coisas dão errado. Blazkowicz e o agente são capturados e enquanto um está sendo interrogado pelo Rudi Jäger (um adestrador de cães sádico) o outro tem  que escapar (que no caso esse é o B.J.) e ainda conseguir as informações de Helga. Escapando do castelo (após o colega agente falecer) Blazkowicz vai à um vilarejo perto onde estava uma agente, indo até essa ela Blazkowicz descobre onde Helga está e tenta conseguir as informações se infiltrando em uma festa, porém obviamente dá tudo errado novamente já que ele é descoberto e uma explosão perto do vilarejo acontece transformando as pessoas em zumbis, escapando do vilarejo e salvando uma das pessoas que ele conheceu (seja uma judia que queria encontrar a amiga ou um cara que pretendia ir até Berlim protestar contra o nazismo) ele vai até as catacumbas onde Helga está (já que ela estava liderando uma escavação e os soldados tentaram abrir um cofre q liberou um gás verde que resultou nos zumbis) e encontra Helga e um oficial chamado Emmerich Schreiner (personagem esquecível) abrindo o cofre e libertando uma criatura gigante responsável pelo gás mortal. Helga tenta controlar a criatura mas não consegue assim a ferindo e matando o Emmerich, então Blazkowicz dá cabo no monstro e finalmente consegue a pasta de Helga que contém a localização do general Deathshead porém desmaia com uma pedra caindo em sua cabeça, ele é resgatado pelo Fergus (personagem do The New Order) e assim voltam à base para a última tentativa dos Aliados de vencerem a Guerra, matar o general Deathshead Wilhelm Strasse. [h3]

É um jogo OK, a primeira metade dele é boa porém quando os soldados nazistas viram zumbis o jogo dá uma caída, parecendo uma versão genérica e sem graça do modo Nazi Zombies (CoD World at War). Personagens são esquecíveis com exceção do Rudi Jäger (já que ele é um boss) e a vilã do jogo é sem graça comparada à Irene Engel (The New Colossus) ou Deathshead (The New Order).

Dá para dividir esse jogo em três partes: Castelo Wolfenstein (a melhor parte), vilarejo e catacumbas. É um jogo curto q dá pra aumentar o tempo jogando os níveis do Wolfenstein 3D (uma fase por capítulo que estão escondidas no mapa) e indo atrás de coletáveis mas ainda sim o tempo de jogo vai ser curto no total.

Não é um jogo ruim mas é mediano, não fede e nem cheira. Se não tiver mais nada pra jogar compre (em promoção) mas não espere muita coisa.

Tempo de jogo: 8 horas (jogando em I AM THE DEATH INCARNATE)
NOTA: 5/10

No tiene la misma profundidad ni el mismo enfoque narrativo que otros títulos de la saga, y se siente más como una expansión que una entrega principal. 
La jugabilidad es rápida y entretenida, con un buen equilibrio de armas y opciones de sigilo, pero la inteligencia artificial de los enemigos es predecible y poco desafiante, la historia es interesante, aunque más simple en comparación con otros juegos de la saga y los personajes secundarios carecen de desarrollo. 
Gráficamente cumple, pero las texturas son algo simples. 

Buen videojuego de igual manera.

184800565.review: 买这游戏全当给前代重返德军总部面子了，看得出来这游戏像是在致敬前一代重返德军总部，有很多前代重返德军总部的场景重现，感觉游戏公司想重制又心有余而力不足，结果就最成这样拉跨冷门，除了画质不再是复古风，游玩性他比不上前代重返德军总部，你说前代重返德军总部后面挖掘地惊悚刺激，这部直接不到挖掘地就有僵尸了，还是是冒火的僵尸，恐怖感荡然无存，食之无味，难吃的不要要的，直接让玩家打起了瞌睡，明明是独立游戏，却搞得好像一个DLC一样粗矿的剧情，游戏有个BUG强制60帧难受，垂直同步还开不了😣，前代重返德军总部重制一下绝对大卖，高中的时候在网吧上通宵玩的，还记得那漫长刺激的剧情和惊悚恐怖的僵尸古代怪物关卡真叫一绝，今尤记得黑衣皮裤紧身衣纳粹性感女子特种兵。

184766534.review:
Good Nazi-killing times. Wonder why I had the sudden urge to play this in late 2024 after I'd already owned it a few years. Huh. A mystery for the ages.

Anyway! It's a good time - if you've played a Wolfenstein game - and who are we kidding, you almost certainly have - then you know what to expect here. The negatives are sparse, and here they go:

1) Bethesda, please, I'm begging you from the bottom of my heart - stop making it so goddamn hard to alt-tab while playing. I'm not a playtester. It's not my job to be in the game for 8 uninterrupted hours. I have stuff to do. This is an application on my computer, I should have the option to move to something else and back.

2) Along the same lines, Bethesda, I don't need like 30 seconds to a minute of unskippable bullshit every time I load it. Get with the times. And by "the times" I mean "any year after like 1995".

3) Quicksaves. Come on. The times per #2. I have other stuff going on. Sure, the autosaves are pretty copious, but your desire to prevent people enjoying the game via savescumming doesn't supercede your players' desire to be able to actually pick up where we left off. Plenty of games prevent quicksaves in combat. Plenty of BETHESDA games already do that. I'm not asking you to reinvent the wheel, just plug in the functionality that already exists in like 98% of all other games.

That's pretty much it. The game's a short one by Wolfenstein standards - 16 hours here (including alt-tabbing and whatnot) and it's done on normal difficulty. I could go achievement-hunting and sink another 5-10 hours into it, but I'm not feeling the urge right now, not when I've got 3 more Wolfensteins to play. The skill tree is smaller than the other games, but the difference they make is actually noticeable. The plot's as straightforward as they get.

Hell, the only thing that I'd call a complaint about gameplay/plot/anything that isn't just the meta-structure of the game itself (like quicksaves or loading) is that the scare chords in the last part of the game get a bit . . . tiresome. Didn't bother me as much as it apparently bothers some others, though, so go with your own tolerance there.

Oh, and the Nightmare levels are *way* easier here than in The New Order, at least. (If you don't know what that means, it's fine, it's not a necessary part of the game or anything.)

All in all, a good bite-sized addition to the franchise.

OH. One other thing, though. The monologues. They started out darkly atmospheric. Then they got tiresome. "Oh, look, a new area, B.J. is gonna monologue about some dust bowl dirt-farmer gray-ass drudgery.  "Smells of damp and mold. Reminds me of Barker. He was my dog 'til I was 8. Got stuck under the porch. Turned into a mold monster. I had to rip his head off with my bare hands while I cried . . ."." After about 8 hours it kinda turned funny for a while. By the end it was fine, but . . . yeah that's a thing.  There were also some funny bits, but they were rare enough that if I told you ONE, I'd be spoiling like 33-50% of them, so I won't.

Anyway: ENJOY!

184466911.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟 (4/5)
"Wolfenstein: The Old Blood, un prequel bourré d’action et d’adrénaline, qui mélange l’horreur gothique et le chaos nazi avec brio."

Wolfenstein: The Old Blood, développé par MachineGames, est un retour aux racines de la franchise, proposant une aventure plus compacte et nostalgique. Avec son ambiance de film d’horreur allemand des années 1940, le jeu capture l’essence des classiques tout en enrichissant l’expérience avec des mécaniques modernes. Une expérience intense et sanglante pour les amateurs de FPS narratifs.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Retour aux sources avec un style nostalgique : Situé avant les événements de The New Order, ce jeu plonge dans l’infiltration de Castle Wolfenstein et la chasse à des artefacts occultes. Parfait pour les fans de longue date de la série.

✅ Action frénétique et variée : Avec un arsenal classique et des ajouts tels que le tuyau multifonctionnel (outil et arme), le gameplay est à la fois rapide et flexible.

✅ Environnement immersif : Le mélange d’architecture nazie imposante et de ruines gothiques ajoute une atmosphère oppressante et immersive.

✅ Ennemis variés : Des soldats nazis aux créatures zombiesques, le jeu maintient une bonne diversité de menaces, renforçant la tension.

✅ Narration efficace : Bien que plus léger sur l’histoire que The New Order, le jeu reste engageant grâce à des dialogues bien écrits et une ambiance bien dosée.

✅ Prix abordable : En tant que standalone, il offre un excellent rapport qualité/prix pour les joueurs souhaitant une aventure compacte.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Durée de vie courte : Avec environ 6 à 8 heures de jeu, l’aventure peut sembler un peu brève pour les joueurs cherchant une expérience plus étoffée.

⚠️ Histoire moins mémorable : Comparé à The New Order, le scénario est plus simple et manque d’émotion ou de profondeur.

⚠️ Structure linéaire : Bien que l’action soit intense, le manque de niveaux ouverts ou d’objectifs secondaires peut limiter la rejouabilité.

⚠️ Difficulté inégale : Certains passages, notamment avec les zombies, peuvent devenir frustrants en raison de la densité des ennemis.

En conclusion :
Wolfenstein: The Old Blood est une aventure préquelle qui mélange brillamment les mécaniques de tir modernes avec une ambiance rétro-gothique. Bien qu’il manque un peu de profondeur narrative et que sa durée soit limitée, il compense par des séquences d’action palpitantes, des environnements mémorables, et un hommage sincère aux origines de la franchise.

🎮 Verdict final :
Un excellent choix pour les fans de FPS qui souhaitent une dose intense de carnage et de nostalgie, sans s’engager dans une campagne longue.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé : 6 à 8 heures pour l’histoire principale, avec des défis pour prolonger un peu l’expérience.
✨ Note personnelle : "Exploser des nazis tout en affrontant des zombies dans un château sinistre ? Oui, s’il vous plaît." 💣🩸

184219269.review:
Wolfenstein: The Old Blood is a highly enjoyable FPS and is a prequel to Wolfenstein: The New Order. It is also shorter than Wolfenstein: The New Order.
Wolfenstein: The Old Blood has a nice, somewhat ridiculous, story, but it's mainly about the gameplay, and I really enjoy the gameplay of these games.
Again, it is violent and has both intense shooting and stealth gameplay, but in this game the gameplay is not interrupted by the story that often.
Therefore, I personally find this game more fun to play and I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys single-player FPS games.

183891232.review:
A prequel to Wolfenstein: The New Order, The Old Blood has more story, but less gameplay. I recommend getting The New Order, as it's got more going for it, has the best story in all of the Wolfenstein games, however the best experience is to get both, as the ending of Old Blood ties perfectly into The New Order, back-to-back.

The Old Blood focuses on a much more supernatural vibe, akin to Indiana Jones, only with more blood, sci-fi technology, and war crimes.

Rudi Jager makes a great Nazi nemesis, with Helga, the penultimate villain, being a lot less interesting in comparison. Neither of them are Deathshead, but Rudi and his dog Greta are especially memorable.

For your friends, you have "Agent One", Wesley, who teaches a clever little trick about dealing with stress, which B.J. later recites in The New Order. Your contact in the village, Kessler, is an admirable resistance fighter, but like most of the characters in The Old Blood, doesn't have much character development. The woman he protects, Annette, is a Jewish refugee looking for her sister in the decrepit and mysterious town of Wulfberg, home to Castle Wolfenstein, the main setting for half of the game, and the place B.J. has escaped once already. You also meet "Agent Two", Pippa, as well as Fergus (the latter only at the ending), but Fergus doesn't receive as much characterisation until The New Order.

Although not as interesting of a story, The Old Blood is as good as any excuse to listen to B.J. Blazkowicz monologue, and the environments of the Nazi super concrete structures are awesome as ever to kill Nazis en masse in.

If you can, get both The Old Blood and The New Order. If you have to pick one, pick The New Order, although it lacks the supernatural, its more grounded but sci-fi environment is filled with overall funner gameplay.

183878174.review: Až po misi s vyzvedáváním dokumentů v hospodě je to dobrý díl

183864402.review:
Personally I don’t want to mention much things about this game. After I did enjoy [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/n-flanders/recommended/201810/]Wolfenstein the New Order[/url] - I decided ‘Ok, now before Wolfenstein 2 I need to pass Old Blood’. And you know what? It was a great mistake.

Maybe I was waiting something more from this game, but from my view - this game is a big mistake, almost same big as ‘Young Blood’. The only good thing about this game is a Wolfenstein Castle, and maybe I may say a story. But in reality story may be tolled in 2 sentences - ‘you need to steel a document, as always everything goes not due to plan. And now your main mission, to stay alive, get out from the castle with a document, which you need to find’.

The first level here shows - ‘No, my friend, it would be interesting, but be ready for pain’. The whole first level is just a big pain, you need to run, hide and try to stay alive. Somebody said ‘Ok, we have two good ideas, and two mechanics, lets use them’. And on those two mechanics is based the whole game. You need to find places for you need to climb and need to find a timing to play with electricity.

If the previous part I was describing as a Love Letter of the series. Here I would say - thats a spoiled apple in the basket. If you don’t have a goal to play all Wolfenstein games, and you look only for a good parts, then play only Wolfenstein the New Order and Wolfenstein 2. Try to avoid the Old Blood part.

183792328.review:
Apresentação:
- Vejo poucas vezes uma ''dlc'' sendo vendida separadamente do seu jogo base.''Wolfsetein the old blood'' é aquele jogo que pode ser visto como um ''mais do mesmo''mas ele certamente não irá te desapontar.

Historia e visual:
- Esse jogo se passa antes do 'the new order' focando em acontecimentos da década de 40 e mostrando os N@zist@s com sua tecnologia que já estava muito avançada.Acompanhamos B.J adrentando nas entralhas do castelo Wolfenstein e enfrentando as armadilhas do castelo e acontecimentos fora do ''normal''.
- O gráfico do jogo ainda se apresenta ser o mesmo igual ao seu antecessor ! mas isso não tira o mérito desse jogo de forma alguma,na verdade ainda é um bom ponto positivo já que: boa parte dos cenários são mt bem construidos e detalhados.

Gameplay e efeitos sonoros:
- A gameplay ainda se mantém mesma igual ao anterior..as novidades aqui é que temos alguns inimigos novos e armas ''novas'' também,no jogo podemos utilizar uma ferramenta que será mt utilizada ao decorrer da campanha ! e que trás elementos novos de play.
- Os efeitos sonoros continuam bons e trazem um novo elemento..o terror.
A tria sonora pode se tornar ausente para alguns com o decorrer do jogo..mas ela brilha de fato nos momentos chave.

Pontos negativos:
- A historia infelizmente não é lá grande coisa não,na verdade ela se torna bastante esquecivel quando vc lembra que 'new order' apresenta uma trama mt melhor..e isso aplica nos personagens também ! boa parte infelizmente acaba não se tornando tão marcantes((nem mesmo os vilãoes)).
Apesar de ter tido uma mecânica nova nesse jogo AINDA é triste o fato de ter tido elementos a mais na gameplay.

Vale a pena ?:
- Se vc jogou 'the new order' e achou o jogo excelente,então eu recomendo fortemente esse jogo.Ele continua tendo uma boa gameplay e trás elementos dos antigos Wolfenstai´ns pra nossa modernidade, apesar da campanha ser bem versátil nos seus cenários..ainda é bem triste a falta de um enredo mais elaborado((pelo menos ele é bem divertido)).
Esse jogo vale seu tempo e dinheiro,se vc gosta de Wolfenstein e de fps com jogabildidade que lembra a velha guarda..então esse jogo é pra vc.

183749239.review:
玩这个游戏的时候我就在想，要是能出一部相同规格的日军总部就好了。7.5/10
最低难度4.6小时通关，除了偶尔的潜行关稍微卡关之外，玩得很开心。先说视听，画面虽然是15年的，但是在15年也算不上出众，就是普普通通，但是能看，不算惊艳也不拖后腿的中庸水平，某些关卡的场景设计的比较惊艳；音乐方面只有结尾的一首曲子，其他时候基本都在突突，配音也是无功无过。
然后是射击手感和关卡设计方面，这两部分是这个游戏的长板，都是中上水准，有两个潜行关略恶心，需要试错几次才能过，剩下的关卡基本就是疯狂突突+找路，地图设计的还不错，基本不怎么迷路，也有一定开放性。
总而言之算是FPS佳作，剧情可有可无吧，后边打丧尸和大怪物都出来了。不过我玩的时候就在想，如果能有这种规格的日军总部就好了，肯定会卖得不错。

183734543.review:
A small but engaging add-on that can easily be played independently from the main MachineGames series. Surprisingly, the game's atmosphere is more reminiscent of Return to Castle Wolfenstein (2001). It lacks the cinematic presentation and dramatic storylines of the main entries, but the core gameplay is solid enough for that not to be an issue.

If you're looking for an unpretentious, action-packed shooter for a couple of evenings, this game is an excellent choice.

183698002.review: é ok! bom pra comprar com desconto e jogar durante um fim de semana só

183686541.review: Game has a bad habit of re-loading the weapon 2X when under a lot of fire. Very annoying

183674683.review: It's pure gameplay galore with enough content to last in the singleplayer action by MachineGames. The Old Blood is just a quite memorable game with distinctive visuals powered by id Tech 5 with significant polishes from the last game and minor touch-ups to the mechanics. In conclusion, get it either in full price or while it's at sale.

183660199.review: gutes Spiel, werde es wieder spielen. Wir sehen uns 2039 zum nächsten Weltkrieg.

183642787.review: I highly recommend to play this one before the New Order, It's solid but a little short. Recommend buying this one at a discount!

183635620.review: „It was perfect,.. perfect. Everything down to the last minute details.“

183632848.review: Un juego muy bueno de wolfenstein y de hecho mi pimer wolfenstein que juge recomiendo empezar con este por que es una precuela del "Wolfenstein The New Order" es un poco corto pero vale la pena jugarlo es muy bueno las animaciones de ejecucion las armas los blindados con metralletas recomiendo este juego bastante a los que les guste MATAR NAZIS

183594833.review:
Came for a nazi shooter, which this game is although it is so weak in every other regard.  

6/10   Don't even buy on sale, not worth the headaches.

Gameplay:  Pistols are more accurate and therefore have a lower TTK than the assault rifles.  Stupid

Low enemy diversity: by level two you have seen all variations except for final boss

Story: meh at best, kept waiting for it to get better and it never happened.

Soundtrack: forgettable

Graphics:  Mid

A few good jokes here and there, but I came for gameplay and couldn't even get ten hours of just point and shoot.  This is just plain bad

183588246.review: A fine shooter with clear influences from Half Life and a foot in the boomer style. Want action, killing nazis and a cool sci-fi environment? Here it is.

183585844.review: Me ha gustado mucho más que "The New Order". Es sencillo y corto pero va al grano y lo que hace lo hace bien.

183546546.review:
After doing 100% of the achievements, I can say the story, weapons, and the characters are great. The soundtrack is good too, imo, and I recommend playing it. The achievements aren't hard to obtain besides maybe getting gold medals for all the challenge maps, but it ain't impossible.

By the way, though New Order was released before Old Blood, play Old Blood first to make it easier to transition with the story.
